void discard_rot_p (const std::vector< FT > *p)
 Must be called after the building process, in order to replace data member 'points' with the original points and discard the rotated points.

Detailed Description

template<class DivisionSpace>
class RKD< DivisionSpace >

RKD's nodes and leaves are stored in arrays. Building and searching for k-NN supported.

Member Typedef Documentation

template<class DivisionSpace >
typedef DivisionSpace::FT RKD< DivisionSpace >::FT

The data type we are using.

std::vector< float > *  rot_v = 0,
const DivisionSpace *  ds_original = 0 
)
inline

Constructor of the tree.

Parameters
ds- the space where the points lie into
nodes_size- number of nodes
leaves_size- number of leaves
nmax- maximum number of points per leaf
rot_v- rotation vector
ds_original- the space where the original points lie into

Parameters

Recursively build the tree.

Parameters
index- index of node/leaf to be created
begin- iterator pointing to start of the data we process
end- iterator pointing to end of the data we process
split_dims- dimensions for splitting
t- number of highest variances to take into account for the splitting.
D- dimension of the points

Recursively search for nearest neighbors.

Parameters
index- index of node/leaf we are accessing
q_rot- rotated query
q- original query
mul_factor- approximation factor
res- vector of results (NNs)
c- number of leaves visited
max_leaf_check- max number of leaves to check
vis- points already visited

Recursively search for nearest neighbors.

Parameters
index- index of node/leaf we are accessing
q_rot- rotated query
q- original query
mul_factor- approximation factor
res- vector of results (NNs)
c- number of leaves visited
max_leaf_check- max number of leaves to check
vis- points already visited
branch- minimum heap of unvisited branches
mindist- current minimum distance
tree_i- tree index
squared_coords- squared coordinates of the points
q_squared_coords- squared coordinates of the queries
q_index- index of query
